=
I'm not trying to say I know how a spirit could 
        record on an analo=
g recorder, or if they can at all: my point was that 
        it wasn't rea=
sonable to assume it could directly change the bits on 
        digital med=
ia and wind up with anything usable.

But, were I to 
        conjecture, o=
ne might say that the air pressure of a voice is converted 
        to a si=
gnal that modifies the magnetic properties of a tape.=C2=A0 And a 
        =
line recording uses a signal, not from the mic, but from some other 
      =
  source, to do the same.=C2=A0 So if that signal were to be manipulated 
 =
       via external EMF, it would change the final result on the tape.=C2=
=A0 
        

Since we are also assuming that digital recorders can pick u=
p 
        spirits, then the simplest explanation is that that same up-fron=
t signal 
        (before it gets digitized into bits) is also being manipu=
lated.=C2=A0 
        And an EMF source could theoretically manipulate both=
 the analog tape 
        signal, and the digital tape signal.

However, it=
 may be that an 
        EMF source strong enough to modify the signal woul=
d also effect all 
        kinds of other things in the unit, including the=
 final media 
        itself.=C2=A0 It would be interesting for someone to =
determine what kind 
        of external EMF is needed to induce or modify =
a signal in the 
        pre-digital phase of the recording circuitry, and =
what side effects that 
        would have.=C2=A0 Depending on the result, =
it could either reveal other 
        ways to detect spirit influence, or p=
rove that no spirit influence (via 
        EMF) is happening.

 make it

need to talk 
                  about what you mean by that.

When you use =
the 
                  microphone, you just speak, and let the recorder do =
the 
                  rest.=C2=A0 In this case, you are using the recorder=
 without 
                  really knowing how it works. =C2=A0 If a spirit=
 can manipulate 
                  the EMF field around the AtoD converter =
(even without using 
                  the mic), then they should be able t=
o do the same: just use it 
                  without knowing how it works:=
 the recorder does the 
                  rest.=C2=A0 In neither case do ei=
ther of you need to know how 
                  it works, to get it to work=
. I am not questioning 
                  this.

But, if they are going to =
change the bits on the 
                  actual media themselves, then the=
y must know how it works, it 
                  order to get all those bit-=
things I mentioned right.=C2=A0 The 
                  recorder can't "do t=
he rest", because by changing the bits on 
                  the media them=
selves, they are going completely around what 
                  the record=
er does, and doing the details themselves.=C2=A0 And 
                  as =
I said, the details there are very technical, and include 
                =
  things like converting their words into digital samples of 
             =
     groups of a specific number of bits in a specific format on 
         =
         specific places in specific orders with other specific other 
    =
              bits connected to them like file ownership and dates and 
   =
               such.=C2=A0 It is the job, basically, of a computer, not a 
=
                  person.

If they are changing the bits on the media, 
   =
               then the recorder is not doing that.=C2=A0 They are no longe=
r 
                  letting the recorder "do it", like you or they would b=
e if 
                  they just used it normally.=C2=A0 The reason you ca=
n "make it 
                  work" without understanding it, is because th=
e recorder is 
                  doing the work for you.=C2=A0 If they are =
to change the media 
                  directly, then the recorder is no lo=
nger doing the work, and 
                  so they must understand all tho=
se digital issues.

So 
                  that is the difference between be=
ing able to use it without 
                  understanding it, and not bei=
ng able to use 
                  it.

   =
                             
Manipulating EMF is one 
                    =
            thing.=C2=A0 But directly storing bits on a 
                  =
              media is way beyond that.=C2=A0 Bits are not 
               =
                 stored in a continuous stream.=C2=A0 They are 
           =
                     broken into bytes (little packets) that is 
          =
                      totally controlled by the processor and 
            =
                    software.=C2=A0 For Elvis to "encode directly" 
       =
                         to the media, he would have to do what that 
     =
                           software does to the digital signals coming in 
=
                                from the AtoD converter: he would have to g=
roup 
                                the bits into (for example) 16 little=
 herds 
                                each, decide on the specific bit in=
terpretation 
                                scheme (2's complement?) ,=C2=
=A0 find space on 
                                the media, update the me=
dia's dictionary of 
                                where there is free sp=
ace and where there isn't, 
                                link the herds =
together with some sort of linked 
                                pointer,=
 skip around the areas marked 'bad' on 
                                the=
 media, update things like date/time modified 
                            =
    and size, respect any kind of ownership 
                              =
  permissions on the media, and so on.

It 
                               =
 is much more credible for the signal to be 
                              =
  manipulated near the AtoD converter (where EMF 
                         =
       changes would have the most straighforward 
                        =
        result) than in the digital media 
                                =
itself.

    <td valign=3D"top"><br>I'm not trying to say I know how a spirit could =

        record on an analog recorder, or if they can at all: my point was =
that 
        it wasn't reasonable to assume it could directly change the b=
its on 
        digital media and wind up with anything usable.<br><br>But,=
 were I to 
        conjecture, one might say that the air pressure of a vo=
ice is converted 
        to a signal that modifies the magnetic properties=
 of a tape.  And a 
        line recording uses a signal, not from the=
 mic, but from some other 
        source, to do the same.  So if that=
 signal were to be manipulated 
        via external EMF, it would change t=
he final result on the tape.  
        <br><br>Since we are also assum=
ing that digital recorders can pick up 
        spirits, then the simplest =
explanation is that that same up-front signal 
        (before it gets digi=
tized into bits) is also being manipulated.  
        And an EMF sourc=
e could theoretically manipulate both the analog tape 
        signal, and =
the digital tape signal.<br><br>However, it may be that an 
        EMF sou=
rce strong enough to modify the signal would also effect all 
        kinds=
 of other things in the unit, including the final media 
        itself.&nb=
sp; It would be interesting for someone to determine what kind 
        of =
external EMF is needed to induce or modify a signal in the 
        pre-dig=
ital phase of the recording circuitry, and what side effects that 
        =
would have.  Depending on the result, it could either reveal other 
  =
      ways to detect spirit influence, or prove that no spirit influence (v=
ia 
        EMF) is happening.<br><br><br><br>--- On <b>Wed, 5/20/09, April=

 <tr>
                <td valign=3D"top">Your points seems to be that you c=
an make it 
                  work without knowing how it works.  So w=
e need to talk 
                  about what you mean by that.<br><br>When =
you use the 
                  microphone, you just speak, and let the reco=
rder do the 
                  rest.  In this case, you are using the =
recorder without 
                  really knowing how it works.   If =
a spirit can manipulate 
                  the EMF field around the AtoD co=
nverter (even without using 
                  the mic), then they should b=
e able to do the same: just use it 
                  without knowing how i=
t works: the recorder does the 
                  rest.  In neither ca=
se do either of you need to know how 
                  it works, to get it=
 to work. I am not questioning 
                  this.<br><br>But, if they=
 are going to change the bits on the 
                  actual media themse=
lves, then they must know how it works, it 
                  order to get =
all those bit-things I mentioned right.  The 
                  record=
er can't "do the rest", because by changing the bits on 
                  =
the media themselves, they are going completely around what 
              =
    the recorder does, and doing the details themselves.  And 
       =
           as I said, the details there are very technical, and include 
  =
                things like converting their words into digital samples of =

                  groups of a specific number of bits in a specific format=
 on 
                  specific places in specific orders with other specif=
ic other 
                  bits connected to them like file ownership and =
dates and 
                  such.  It is the job, basically, of a com=
puter, not a 
                  person.<br><br>If they are changing the bit=
s on the media, 
                  then the recorder is not doing that.&nbs=
p; They are no longer 
                  letting the recorder "do it", like=
 you or they would be if 
                  they just used it normally.&nbs=
p; The reason you can "make it 
                  work" without understandi=
ng it, is because the recorder is 
                  doing the work for you=
.  If they are to change the media 
                  directly, then t=
he recorder is no longer doing the work, and 
                  so they mus=
t understand all those digital issues.<br><br>So 
                  that is=
 the difference between being able to use it without 
                  und=
erstanding it, and not being able to use 
                  it.<br><br><br>=
